lead.p: parseInt â€“ Parses a string as an integer

parameters.parameter: A numeric value between 2 and 36 specifying the representation.

return.p: Returns an integer representation of the string.

example.heading: parseInt example
example.code:
console.log(parseInt('123 String')); // 123 console.log(parseInt('String 123')); // NaN console.log(parseInt('12')); // 12 console.log(parseInt(12)); // 12 console.log(parseInt('12.42')); // 12
console.log(parseInt(Infinity)); // NaN console.log(parseInt('Infinity')); // NaN
console.log(parseInt('255', 8)); // 173
